events.title: Declaration of Arbroath
events.description: Scottish barons and nobles signed the Declaration of Arbroath, asserting Scotland's independence from England and affirming Robert the Bruce as king.
events.significance: It is an early and influential statement of Scottish nationhood and sovereignty, symbolizing the struggle for Scottish independence.

events.title: First Modern Olympic Games Open in Athens
events.description: The first modern Olympic Games were held in Athens, Greece, reviving the ancient sporting tradition and establishing the foundation for the modern international Olympic movement.
events.significance: Marked the beginning of the modern Olympic Games, fostering international sportsmanship and global unity through athletic competition.

events.title: United States Enters World War I
events.description: The United States declared war on Germany, joining the Allies in World War I after years of maintaining neutrality.
events.significance: This decision significantly altered the course of World War I by providing the Allies with fresh troops and resources, contributing to the eventual defeat of the Central Powers.
